meanings.definition: Enzymes that are responsible for the formation of prostaglandins.
meanings.sent1: Cyclooxygenases help make prostaglandins in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study cyclooxygenases to understand how prostaglandins are produced.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenases in our cells are like tiny factories producing prostaglandins.
meanings.sent4: In the biochemical orchestra of the body, cyclooxygenases are the conductors of prostaglandin synthesis.
meanings.sent5: Imagine cyclooxygenases as the chefs cooking up prostaglandins in our bodies.

meanings.definition: Proteins that play a key role in the inflammatory response.
meanings.sent1: During inflammation, cyclooxygenases become active to help the body respond.
meanings.sent2: The immune system relies on cyclooxygenases to trigger inflammation when needed.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenases at the site of injury are like firefighters rushing to put out a fire.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against infection, cyclooxygenases are the frontline soldiers in the inflammatory army.
meanings.sent5: Cyclooxygenases are the alarm bells that signal the start of the body's defense response.

meanings.sent1: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs work by blocking cyclooxygenases in the body.
meanings.sent2: When you take painkillers, they inhibit cyclooxygenases to reduce inflammation.
meanings.sent3: The cyclooxygenases are like the bullseye for the medication to hit and stop inflammation.
meanings.sent4: In the war against pain, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs aim directly at cyclooxygenases.
meanings.sent5: Cyclooxygenases are the key that unlocks the door to pain relief through medication.
